bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 163, Number 206 (Monday, December 18, 2017)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. NORTON:H.R. 4678.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:clause 17 of section 8 of article I of the Constitution.[Page H10180]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E1717)

summary.text:
District of Columbia Civil Enforcement Equality Act

This bill authorizes the District of Columbia government to enter into contingency fee arrangements with private attorneys for legal matters affecting the District.

bill.title: District of Columbia Civil Enforcement Equality Act

item.title: District of Columbia Civil Enforcement Equality Act

To permit the District of Columbia to make payments pursuant to contingency fee arrangements entered into by the Attorney General of the District of Columbia for the provision of legal services in claims and other legal matters affecting the interests of the District of Columbia, and for other purposes.
District of Columbia Civil Enforcement Equality Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
